titleStmt.title: A Perfect catalogue of the peeres of the realm of England viz. Dukes, Marquesses, Earles, Viscounts, and Barons now sitting in this present Parliament, began at Westminster the 8th day of May in the 12th year of the reign of our Gracious Soveraign Lord King Charles the Second &c., 1661 : together with the auncient statute for placing the Lords in all Parliaments and other assemblies and conferences of councils.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Sam Brooks and are to be sold by most book-sellers in London,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
